results.title: The Eclipse = L'eclisse
results.creator_credit: Raymond Hakim, Robert Hakim, Interopa Film - Cineriz, Paris Film Productions and Michelangelo Antonioni
results.brief_description: This, the third in Antonioni’s “cycle of sentiments”, begins with the break up of Vittoria (Monica Vitti) and her partner Riccardo. The film then follows Vittoria and Piero (Alain Delon) while a love affair is cautiously entered into. At times using plot and dialogue to spell out the themes, for the most part the confusion of the characters is suggested more carefully by the film’s surfaces, both in its use of composition and in the soundtrack. There are also intense concentrations on the surfaces and the figures that create character, but these are often diminished by reframing or set in tension with the solid forms of the architecture. ‘L’eclisse’ is preoccupied with immateriality and it is by way of edging away from any clear definition that it maintains a distinctly ‘modern’ air. Italian language with English subtitles.

results.title: The Echinoderms (TEFC): starfish, brittle stars, sea urchins, sea cucumbers
results.brief_description: Looks at the tide pool animals the echinoderms which share their evolutionary limbs with our own phylum. The segments introduce sea stars, brittle stars, basket stars, sea urchins, sand dollars and sea cucumbers.

results.title: The Echinoderms
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
A few species of the phylum Echinodermata found in the rich environment of the North American Pacific coast are shows. Four of the five classes are found in the inter-tidal region: Asteroidea, sea-stars; Ophiuroidea, brittle stars; Holothuriodea, sea cucumbers; and Echinoidea, sea-urchins. Uses micro-photogpraphy.

results.title: The Ebony tower
results.creator_credit: Roy Roberts, Granada International Productions, Robert Knights and John Fowles
results.brief_description: An aging artist (Laurence Olivier) and his two young companions, “The Mouse” (Greta Scacchi) and “The Freak” (Toyah Willcox) find their idyllic life suddenly interrupted by the visit of a young art critic (Roger Rees). Based on the book by John Fowles with screenplay by John Mortimer.

results.title: The Eating on the run film

results.title: The Eating feel good movie
results.brief_description: In this film, food becomes a visual delight and eating is seen as fun. The film aims to develop understanding of the body’s needs for different kinds of foods and how basic foods are used by the body. This film attempts to make children aware of the advantages of eating the correct foods.

results.title: The Earthling
results.creator_credit: Samuel Z Arkoff, Elliot Schick, John Strong and Peter Collinson
results.brief_description: Patrick Foley, dying presumably of cancer, returns from America to his outback country town. There, after the briefest of conversations with long-lost acquaintances, he sets off over the mountains to a remote and hidden valley where his father once carved out a small farm. On his way, he comes accross Shawn Daley, who has just seen his mother and father die in a campervan accident. Lost, angry and afraid, Shawn seeks Patrick’s help but is coldly rebuffed. The irascible Patrick wants nothing to do with anybody else and tells the boy he must fend for himself. Shawn has no choice but to keep hounding Patrick, and the rest of the film is the changing relationship between this dying man and a dependent child. Cast includes William Holden, Ricky Schroder, Jack Thompson and Olivia Hamnett.

results.title: The Earth trembles = La terra trema
results.creator_credit: Salvo D'Angelo, Universalia Film and Luchino Visconti
results.brief_description: La terra trema tells the story of the Valestro family and their struggle to survive as fishermen in the Sicilian village Aci Trezza. A fantastic example of neo-realism, Luchino Visconti uses non-professional actors and focuses on the tightly knit Valestro family to create a gripping and moving account of poverty in Southern Italy. With beautiful photography by G.R. Aldo and narration by Visconti and Antonio Pietrangeli. Won the Special Prize in the 1948 Venice Film Festival. Franco Zeffirelli worked as an assitant director. In Italian with English subtitles.
